channel.title: Client hacking
channel.description: I was talking to someone i know from some game earlier, who is or atleast used to be an rs cheater and we were talking about cheating when he brought up client hacking... He said he was trying or had tried to make a client using javassist, what i think is somewhat similar to bcel... He also said "I think the new rs client uses reflection to invoke methods" whatever that means Prolly useless, but in case you wanted to know :rolleyes: :P He also mentionned modifying sdk, but we're already doing :) (http://www.csg.is.titech.ac.jp/~chiba/javassist/)

item.title: Client hacking
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Javassist is less powerful than BCEL, but also much easier to use (BCEL with Chiba's Java-like syntax support would be awesome.)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Pwnd:

Regex, what the fuck?

It's pretty funny at firstr, but he literally has posted this like 50 times now. Its not funny anymore and he's probably gonna get a warning for spamming.

Read full topic

item.title: Client hacking
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I don't reckon there is any way we could change the reflection class (in rt.jar) to work on our behalf is there? for example if jagex is requesting info give them the wrong info?

Read full topic

item.title: Client hacking
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

It does use reflection to invoke methods, also uses it to check/mod fields.

They also use it to check access of classes, fields, and methods. Not smart to change the access. ;D

Your friend is bright.

Javassist is kind of icky, and somewhat slow. But hey, whatever gets the job done

Read full topic

I was talking to someone i know from some game earlier, who is or atleast used to be an rs cheater and we were talking about cheating when he brought up client hacking...
He said he was trying or had tried to make a client using javassist, what i think is somewhat similar to bcel...
He also said "I think the new rs client uses reflection to invoke methods" whatever that means
Prolly useless, but in case you wanted to know :rolleyes:
He also mentionned modifying sdk, but we're already doing
(http://www.csg.is.titech.ac.jp/~chiba/javassist/)
